name: Avoid unreferenced Tables
Avoid unreferenced views
Avoid triggers, functions and procedures with a very low comment/code ratio
Avoid undocumented triggers, functions and procedures
Avoid Artifacts with High Cyclomatic Complexity
Avoid Artifacts with High Depth of Code
Avoid Artifacts with High Essential Complexity
Avoid Artifacts with High Integration Complexity
Avoid Artifacts with High Fan-In
Avoid Artifacts with High Fan-Out
Avoid Artifacts with lines longer than X characters
Avoid Artifacts with SQL statement including subqueries
Avoid Artifacts with a Complex SELECT Clause
Avoid tables not involved in a Foreign Key
Avoid using GOTO statement
Avoid Artifacts with High RAW SQL Complexity
Avoid large Artifacts - too many Lines of Code
Avoid Tables with more than 20 columns on an OLTP system
Avoid unreferenced Functions
Never use SQL queries with a cartesian product
Never use SQL queries with a cartesian product on XXL Tables
Avoid non-indexed SQL queries
Avoid non-indexed XXL SQL queries
Avoid non-SARGable queries
Avoid NATURAL JOIN queries
Specify column names instead of column numbers in ORDER BY clauses
Avoid queries using old style join convention  instead of ANSI-Standard joins
Avoid Artifacts with too many parameters
Avoid using the GROUP BY clause
Avoid using quoted identifiers
Avoid Tables without Primary Key
Avoid using dynamic SQL in SQL Artifacts
Always define column names when inserting values
Use MINUS or EXCEPT operator instead of NOT EXISTS and NOT IN subqueries
Avoid Artifacts with queries on too many Tables and or Views
Avoid exists and not exists independent clauses
DISTINCT should not be used in SQL SELECT statements
Use ANSI standard operators in SQL WHERE clauses
Replace OR conditions testing equality on the same identifier in SQL WHERE clauses by an IN test condition
Avoid empty catch blocks
